meanings.definition: To signal or indicate in advance
meanings.sent1: The teacher presignalled the upcoming test by mentioning it in class.
meanings.sent2: The traffic lights presignalled the upcoming stop with a yellow light.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel presignalled its friends about the approaching cat with a series of chirps.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds presignalled the impending storm with flashes of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The old clock presignalled the hour with a loud chime.

meanings.sent1: The presignalled message on the board informed the students about the schedule change.
meanings.sent2: The presignalled train departure time helped passengers plan their journey.
meanings.sent3: The presignalled surprise party left the birthday girl speechless.
meanings.sent4: The presignalled warning about the icy road conditions prevented accidents.
meanings.sent5: The presignalled arrival of the guests made the host prepare extra snacks.
